position.marginalia_text: Ioannes Dee hanc sibi venia[m] a doctis co[n]cedi cupit Mathematicis, vt q[uo]n[i]a[m] hactenus tota Antiquitas Geometria[e] no[st]r[a]e celebravit arte[m] eande[m] vt Schematica[e] [insigniat no[st]r[a]e - deleted] siue potius Megethoscopa[e], no[st]r[a]e, insigniat. 1559. 22 Maij Welbor[niae]

marginalia.translation: John Dee desired that this favour be granted to him by learned mathematicians, as [quam/quoniam?] so far the whole antiquity of our geometry celebrated the same art so that it distinguishes by form or rather Megethoscopic. 22 May, 1559. Welborn[...].

position.marginalia_text: Geometria[e] eiu[s] no[min]em tum ad res terrenas dimetiendas convenit, qualia n[ost]ra pura ars no[n] tractat sed

dici potuisset qua[m] geometria [a]eque eiu[s] in ca[e]lestu[m] corporu[m] magnitudinibus et intervallis dimetiend[is] occupatur, ac [...] motu[m] siue Arear[um]: vnde partis nome[n] est no[n] totius artis: Modo ad sensibilia descendere, artis esse p[ro]prium daremus: vnde cum re[s] ad sensibilia descende[re]t, et amplior sit, qua[m] dictiona[e] illa geometria[e] significari possit de alio erat cogitandu[m] no[m]i[n]e convenientur. Illud aute[m] si sit Megethoscopica[e], vel tale quid, animo philosophantes examinand[o] retiquo Hoc eiu[s] nomen materia[m] huius artis p[ro]priu[m] pra[e]cipuu[m]q[ue] artis fine denotat.
